name: Gift Certificate - Give the gift of ADORA this holiday season!
description:
ADORA by Simona now offers gift certificates. Give your significant other, family members or friends a gift certificate to purchase any item in our gallery or to create their very own one-of-a-kind handmade jewelry design. 

Gift Certificates are available in $25, $50, $75, $100, $150 and $200. If you are not able to find the denomination that perfectly suits your needs, please contact us and will gladly provide the denomination to accommodate you.

Gift Certificates do not need to be used all at once. Any remaining balance will stay in the recipient's gift certificate account and can be used for future purchases, but are non-transferable and can not be redeemed for cash. Gift Certificates cannot be used to purchase additional Gift Certificates. 

NOTE ~ GIFT CARDS DO NO EXPIRE !

To purchase:
Choose the desired denomination from the drop-down menu on the right of the page and add to your cart. In an e-mail sent to us separately (via either the "Contact Us" feature or at simona@adorabysimona.com), please provide:

~ the recipient's name

~ your name and any message you would like on the certificate

Go through with the transaction via PayPal. After your purchase is complete, you will receive an electronic gift card similar to the ones pictured above (you can also choose your preferred picture for the gift certificate and let me know of your choice, picture # 1 through 5). The gift card will be completed with the information that you provide to us and it will have a unique code that can only be used by the recipient. The gift card can be printed from the comfort of your own home or office. 

To redeem the gift certificate:

1. To redeem your Gift Certificate, visit our studio at www.adorabysimona.com

2. Choose your desired item(s) and copy their links.

3. Send us an email with the links to your desired item(s), entering the gift certificate code as well as your shipping information.

4. I will contact you within 24 hours and give you a link to a "Reserved Listing" containing your desired item(s) and instructions on how to proceed. 

5.  If your transaction exceeds the value of the gift certificate, you will need to pay the balance via PayPal to complete checkout. If checkout is not completed, your order will not be processed. 

5. Please safeguard your gift certificate. ADORA by Simona is not responsible for lost gift certificates or their codes.

name: "Wild Heart" - Swarovski Crystal and Sterling Silver Necklace
description:
A flawless crystal heart (17mm) in one of Swarovski's amazing color innovations called "Vitrail Light" is quite eye-catching on this delicate necklace. The many facets in the crystal capture and reflect the light from all angles in a wild array of vibrant colors, from green to blue, to red, to yellow, etc., that create a dizzying effect. The pendant is enhanced by a sterling silver bail studded with clear cubic zirconia that sparkle beautifully, and hangs on a twisted sterling silver chain, 18" long, with a lobster claw closure and a tiny crystal detail for added playfulness. 

Handcrafted - One of a kind design.

Swarovski (Austrian) Crystal is considered to be of finest quality, unmatched in clarity and distinction. When Daniel Swarovski first brought a sparkle to crystal over a hundred years ago, he could have never imagined what a development he was setting in motion. With fantasy, intuition and technical finesse, he managed to expose all the facets hidden within this fascinating material.

Today, sparkling Crystal Components in thousands of colors, shapes and sizes provide a fantastic palette of inspiration for designers and manufacturers.

name: "Glamour" - Crystal and Copper Cuff Bracelet
description:
Sophisticated and radiant, this handcrafted cuff bracelet tranforms any time into a special event.  Created with wide interconnected links featuring alternating golden and and dark amber colored crystals set in copper, the bracelet wraps around the wrist without flaw for a very glamorous look.  

The bracelet can be adjusted from a 7" up to an 8" wrist circumference and measures 1 1/4" at its widest point.  

The closure is a classic lobster clasp with a 1 1/2" extension chain for comfortable sizing, and a tiny crystal drop detail for added playfulness.  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

name: "Setting Sun" - Carnelian and Pearl Necklace and Earrings Set
description:
Like the unexpected fire of a sunset, or the first flash of autumn brilliance this necklace captivates. In the mix there is translucent orange carnelian, lustrous Biwa pearls in a deep burgundy color, champagne freshwater pearls and red goldstone associated with vitality and energy. The multi-layered pendant features a Swarovski cosmic circle crystal from which hangs a darker and more opaque carnelian pendant (20x50mm) polished to capture the light and reflecting it in shades of deep orange and red. Copper, vermeil and 14K GP elements accentuate and brighten this beautiful combination of gemstones, pearls and crystals. 

The 18" (approx. 46cm) long necklace is completed by a round toggle clasp with a rope design and a tiny crystal accent added for a playful touch. The pendant measures 4" (approx. 10cm) in length including the bail.

The earrings are simple, meant to just complete the set and not take away from the dramatic effect of the necklace. They feature a single freshwater coin pearl (approx. 12mm) accented by a Swarovski crystal studded rondelle and a 5mm round goldstone, hanging from french hook style 14K gold-plated ear wires. The overall length of the earring is 1 1/2" (approx. 38mm). 

Handcrafted - One of a kind design.

A glassy, translucent stone, Carnelian is an orange-colored variety of Chalcedony, a mineral of the Quartz family. Its color varies from pale pinkish-orange to a deep rusty brown, though it is most known for its brilliant orange and red-orange crystals. Its bold energy brings a rush of warmth and joy that lingers, stimulating and empowering. Known as a stone of motivation and endurance, leadership and courage, Carnelian has protected and inspired throughout history.

The ancient Egyptians called Carnelian "the setting sun." In its orange hues, they identified it with the receptive or passive female energies. In its red, red-orange to reddish brown shades, they considered it the active male energy stone, recognized by its glowing vibrant color. Carnelian is traditionally worn to enhance passion, love, and desire.

name: "Mystère" - Cultured Pearl and 18K Gold-Filled Necklace/Earrings/Set
description:
Mysterious and exotic, this unique necklace and earrings set features excellent quality freshwater coin pearls (12mm) in an iridescent ivory color, accented by intricately textured 14K and 18K gold-filled rings and links.

Choose between Necklace, Earrings or both pieces as a Set for a greater value:
Necklace - $48.99
Earrings - $48.99
Set - $87.98

The necklace features three lustrous coin pearls hanging on an 18K gold-filled delicate chain, 18" long (approx. 46cm), with a lobster claw closure and a tiny pearl drop detail for added playfulness. Total weight of the necklace is 11.5g (approx. 0.4oz). 

The earrings are simple and elegant, with only two pearls on each. The oversized (25mm long) 14K gold-filled ear wires are custom-made and hammered for added strength and texture. Overall length of the earring is 42mm (approx. 1 5/8"). Total weight for the pair is 8g (approx. 0.28oz) or 4g (approx. 0.14oz) per earring. 

Each pearl has a carat weight of approx. 5.5ct (1ct=200mg) for a total carat weight of the pearls of 38.5ct.

Handcrafted - One of a kind design. 

Pearl is the official birthstone for the month of June as adopted by the American National Association of Jewelers in 1912. It is also the birthstone for the Sun Signs of Gemini and Cancer.

Gold-filled is an actual layer of gold-pressure bonded to another metal. Gold-filled is not to be confused with gold plating as filled literally has 100% more gold than gold plating. Gold-filled is much more valuable and tarnish resistant. It does not flake off, rub off or turn colors. As a matter of fact, anyone who can wear gold can wear gold-filled without worries of any allergic reaction to the jewelry. Gold-filled jewelry is an economical alternative to solid gold! 

Gold-filled items are regulated by the government. These items are therefore so much better then gold-plated which has no regulations at all. 

Gold-filled jewelry is made from solid gold and filled with other alloys such as rhodium (a member of the platinum family), brass, and sterling silver. Gold-filled wears, looks and lasts like solid gold because its outer surface IS solid gold. Everything you can see and touch is pure gold. In the jewelry industry the quantity of gold must be at least 1/20th by weight of the total product. Gold-filled items are generally considered lifetime products, and the gold layer will not wear off, as it will in electroplated products. 

Gold-filled jewelry is often called the wave of the future because it offers all the same characteristics as solid gold such as strength, durability and beauty....but at a fraction of the cost! 

Caring for Gold Filled items is as easy as caring for any gold jewelry. Simply keep away from chemicals, clean regularly with mildly sudsy water, rinse well and pat dry with a non-scratching cloth. Polish gently with a jewelry polishing cloth.

name: "Infinity" - Pyrope Garnet Earrings
description:
One of the most magical symbols, 'infinity' is thought to signify love without end, constantly recurring. It reminds us that love is in fact unlimited - the depth and vastness of this love is not bound by time or place. In ancient India and Tibet, the infinity symbol represents perfection, dualism, and unity between male and female. It is linked to magic and represents equilibrium, or the balance of various forces. 

Casual yet elegant, this beautiful pair of earrings features 18K gold-plated infinity circles in a soft satin finish with the larger circle encasing a deep red garnet drop (8x8mm), that dangles playfully as it reflects the light with every facet. The garnet drops are cut, faceted and polished by hand.  Garnet occurs in every color except blue, and most varieties are named for their color. Pyrope Garnet and is the most famous of the red garnets. Its dark, blood red color often resembles the color of ruby and it owes its color to a strong concentration of magnesium and aluminum. 

18K GP french hook style ear wires. 

Overall length of the earring is 45mm (approx. 1 3/4"). 

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

Garnet is the birthstone for January and the stone that celebrates the 2nd anniversary of marriage. The name “garnet” comes from the Latin word “Garanatus,” meaning “seedlike,” in reference to a pomegranate, much like the bright red seeds you find inside in a pomegranate. The garnet has been a popular gem throughout history. Garnets were found as beads in a necklace worn by a young man in a grave that dates back to 3000 B.C. This is proof of the hardness and durability of the stone.

Garnets range from a 7.0 to 7.5 on the Mohs scale of hardness and are found in the U.S. (Arizona), South Africa, Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Myanmar (Burma), Scotland, Switzerland and Tanzania. They are formed when high temperatures and/or pressure is a factor and geologists often use garnets as a gauge of the amount of temperature and pressure that was present during their formation.

Folklore, Legend, and Healing Properties:  Garnet's powers include healing, strength, and protection and it is often worn to relieve inflammations of the skin. It is also believed to regulate the heart and blood flow and aid in curing depression. In earlier times, garnets were exchanged as gifts between friends to demonstrate their affection for each other and to insure that they meet again.

name: "Eliana" - Titanium-Coated Brazilian Amethyst Drusy and Vermeil Earrings
description:
An exquisite pair of earrings featuring lightweight drusy amethyst teardrops (14x20mm) with a spectacular metallic titanium coating that catches and reflects the light with beautiful brilliance. Adding length and dimension to the overall look of the earring, a tiny 3mm amethyst rondelle, flawlessly cut and faceted, completes the design. 

The oversized 24K vermeil (gold over sterling silver) ear wires are hammered for added strength and texture and measure 22mm in length.  

Overall length of the earring is 48mm (approx. 1 7/8").  

Total weight for the pair is 6.4g (approx. 0.22oz) or 3.2g (approx. 0.11oz) per each earring.

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

Amethyst is a meditative and calming stone which works in the emotional, spiritual and physical planes to provide calm, balance, patience and peace. Purple Amethyst has been highly esteemed throughout the ages for its stunning beauty and legendary powers to stimulate and soothe the mind and emotions. It is a semi-precious stone in today’s classifications, but to the ancients it was a “Gem of Fire,” a Precious Stone worth as much as a Diamond. It has always been associated with February, the month the Romans dedicated to Neptune, their water-god, and is the traditional birthstone of that month. It is the stone of St. Valentine and faithful love, and signifies ecclesiastical dignity as the Bishop’s Stone. It carries the energy of fire and passion, creativity and spirituality, yet bears the logic of temperance and sobriety.

The best varieties of Amethysts can be found in Siberia, Sri Lanka, Brazil and the far East.

Drusy, druse, druzy, drusies - different spellings, but they all mean tiny quartz crystals that form within or on the surface of other stones.  When ground water carrying dissolved silica is forced into a porous area of the rock, rapid cooling often occurs, causing the formation of tiny crystals on the surfaces or in cavities of the rock. The clear crystals often form on top of previously deposited minerals. This is called a drusy.  

Titanium drusy is drusy that has been coated with titanium in a vacuum chamber. It produces a permanent metal coating in spectacular shades that are hard to reproduce in other ways.

name: "White Nights" - Angel Aura Drusy and 18K Gold Filled Necklace
description:
Simple and elegant, this show-stopping necklace will draw attention and compliments without fail. The asymmetrical angel aura drusy pendant is gilded in gold leaf and measures 30x17x6mm (approx. 1 1/8"L x 5/8"W x 1/4"D). A cluster of tiny colorful gemstone rondelles (blue topaz, citrine, peridot and amethyst) dangles playfully from the pendant on top of three chain fringes of different lengths.  The total length of the pendant measured from the top of the bail to the end of the longest chain fringe is 89mm (approx. 3 1/2").

The pendant is set on a cz-studded bail and hangs on a delicate 18K gold-filled chain, 18" long, with a lobster clasp closure. 

Versatile, it goes well with your favorite pair of jeans, as well as with that perfect black dress. 

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

Angel Aura Quartz Crystals are created by bonding a natural clear Quartz crystal with a precious metal infusion of pure platinum and silver, resulting in an immensely powerful protection combination which fuses the White, Blue, Violet and Silver Rays into an iridescent display of Light. It is considered a stone of high spiritual energy, said to be very helpful to the aura which it can protect, balance, and bring energetic health to. It is often used in meditation and can help one meditate on finding the proper course of action in life. It is also said to bring peace and tranquility because of the angelic protection it provides. Physically, mystical lore reputes that angel aura is helpful for general health, vitality, and miraculous cure of illness. Angel aura is associated primarily with the crown chakra.

description:

Translucent, the stones are flawlessly cut and faceted, and sparkle beautifully in tones of red, pink and fuchsia.  

The 14K gold-filled french hook style ear wires are hand-forged and also hammered for added strength and texture. 

The overall length of the earring is 50mm (approx. 2"). 

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

Lab-created gemstones are not imitations. For example, diamonds, rubies, sapphires and emeralds have been manufactured in labs to possess identical chemical and physical characteristics to the naturally occurring variety. Synthetic (lab-created) corundum, including ruby and sapphire, are very common and they cost only a fraction of the natural stones. 

Whether a gemstone is a natural stone or a lab-created (synthetic) stone, the characteristics of each are the same. Lab-created stones tend to have a more vivid color to them, as impurities are not present in a lab and do not modify the clarity or color of the stone, unless added intentionally for a specific purpose.

name: "Ayda" - Cyan Banded Drusy Agate and Sterling Silver Necklace
description:
Simply exquisite! This unique necklace features a gorgeous cyan banded drusy agate pendant in beautiful shades of aqua with white marbling swirls, coupled with cushion-cut prasiolite (also known as green amethyst) and a tiny pear-cut smoky quartz. The center of the main stone is hollow and surrounded by clear quartz crystals that reflect the light beautifully. Each of the three gemstones features a different cut and facets, which add dimension to the overall design without altering the balance of the whole. Encased in solid sterling silver, the pendant measures 53mm (approx. 2 1/8") in length including the bail and 32mm (approx. 1 1/4") at its widest point. The weight of the pendant including the gemstones is 11g (approx. 0.4oz).

The pendant is hanging on a sterling silver snake chain, lightweight and fluid. It measures 18" in length, the width of it is 3mm, and it weighs 5g (approx. 0.18oz). The closure is an S-hook clasp with a tiny agate detail.  

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

Agate is the Mystical birthstone for September. It is also the birthstone for the Zodiac sign of Gemini.

Agate provides a calming influence, improves perception, concentration and helps to develop and increase one's analytical talents.

name: "Autumn" - Oxidized Copper and Turquoise Asymmetrical Necklace
description:
The turquoise is ancient, yet again and again it finds itself back in vogue. Its shining sky blue is one of the most popular trend colors in the world of jewelry and fashion. In many cultures of the Old and New Worlds, this gemstone has been esteemed for thousands of years as a holy stone, a bringer of good fortune, or a talisman. 

Quality greenish-blue turquoise nuggets with intricate brown matrix steal the show in this beautiful asymmetrical two-strand necklace. Paired with huge freshwater pearl nuggets in a deep coppery color, orange topaz and amber crystals, this necklace glows with the gorgeous colors of autumn. Textured copper chains in various shapes and sizes add a modern twist and a vibrant contrast to the overall design. 

Measuring 50x55mm (approx. 2x2 1/8"), the statement pendant is made of textured copper that was treated with a beeswax-based green patina to create an oxidized, weathered look.  The necklace closes asymmetrically on one side with a large toggle clasp in the shape of a grape leaf that was also oxidized for an antiqued look and has a tiny charm hanging playfully on one side.  

Overall length of the necklace is 51cm (approx. 20"). 

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

Turquoise is the modern December birthstone and the accepted gem for the fifth and eleventh wedding anniversaries. 

Turquoise is a valuable mineral and is one of the most valuable non-transparent minerals used in the jewelry trade. It has been mined by early Egyptians since at least 6000 BC. Most specimens are cryptocrystalline, meaning that the crystals can only be seen by a microscope. The finest turquoise comes from Iran but is challenged by some southwestern United States specimens. The name comes from the French word turquoise, meaning "stone of Turkey". 

A sacred stone for the North American Indians as well as the Tibetans, it is often used by shamans in rituals and ceremonies. It is said to promote mental and spiritual clarity and expansion and to enhance wisdom, trust, kindness and understanding.

name: "Atlantis" - Mystic Topaz, Freshwater Pearl and Sterling Silver Necklace and Earrings Set
description:
AS DISPLAYED AT GBK PRODUCTIONS' 2013 PRIMETIME EMMYS CELEBRITY GIFTING LOUNGE

ADORA by Simona, in association with The Artisan Group®, participated in an invitation-only luxury celebrity gift lounge hosted by GBK Productions on September 20-21, 2013 held at the W Hotel in the heart of Hollywood, California, in honor of the 2013 Primetime Emmys Nominees and Presenters. Created exclusively for this event, the "Atlantis" Necklace and several male leather wrap bracelets were prominently featured on display at The Artisan Group's exhibit. Actors, actresses, celebrity managers and members of the press had an opportunity to try on the showcase pieces supplied by ADORA by Simona, and took home in their gift bag the "En Vogue" earrings also designed exclusively for this event. 

This necklace accompanied by matching earrings is now available for sale! 

A stunning necklace for the pearl lovers! Set in sterling silver and measuring 1 5/8" (approx. 43mm) long and 3/4" (approx. 18mm) at its widest point, the flawlessly faceted mystic topaz featured in this exotic pendant is sure to draw a lot of attention! Two strands of high-lustre ivory pearls (7-8mm), and a round sterling silver spring clasp (20mm) that closes in the front complete the design.  

The pendant can easily be removed from the clasp, making it possible to wear this versatile necklace multiple ways. By removing the pendant you can have a completely different necklace, a simple, classy two-strands of pearls which can be worn either with the clasp asymmetrically on one side, or with it concealed in the back.     

Overall length of the necklace is 18" (approx. 46cm) - add 1 5/8" (approx. 43mm) for the pendant.  The weight of the pendant - gemstone and sterling silver together - is 12g (approx. 0.42oz).

The earrings are simple, meant to just complete the set and not take away from the dramatic effect of the necklace.  They feature a single lustrous freshwater pearl (approx. 11mm) accented by a tiny titanium-coated drusy agate bead shimmering in all colors of the rainbow (to match the colors in the pendant), and hang from a custom hammered sterling silver ear wire.  The overall length of the earring is 1 3/8" (approx. 34mm). 

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

Borrowing its name from Plato's mythical island Atlantis, the pendant in this unique necklace shimmers with the light of a thousand rainbows.  Mystic topaz is a relatively new type of enhanced gemstone, but its unique multicolored brilliance is making it one of the most sought after gems of today.  To create mystic topaz, high-quality natural colourless topaz is treated with a thin coating of titanium which is applied to the underside of the stone. It is the application of this coating that creates the stunning rainbow colours from blue, green and yellow to small bursts of red shades. This striking iridescent effect makes mystic topaz the perfect choice for unique jewelry.

name: Golden Pearl Drop Earrings
description:

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

The shell pearl is made from mother of pearls, the hard inner layer of the shell of an oyster. The process of making a shell pearl involves several different stages. 

The raw material for the base of the pearl is the sea shell, which is then cut, rounded, shaped, drilled and strung. The pearls thus formed are later framed and dyed in various shades. After the pearls are baked and polished, they receive their final stringing. 

In order to produce a good quality pearl, a key ingredient is what is called a 'mother of pearl bead'. This element adds weight, value and durability to the pearl. In fact, the materials used in order to make shell pearls are the same materials from which cultured pearls are made.

name: "Ladder To My Heart" - Swarovski Crystal and Antiqued Brass Bracelet
description:
This elegant bracelet is crafted in antiqued brass with Swarovski crystals. Each link is studded with crystals in Crystal Golden Shadow, Crystal Silver Shade, and Aurora Borealis colors. The crystals are all faceted and capture the light from every angle, sparkling beautifully. 

The closure is a 10x12mm toggle clasp also studded with light gold Swarovski crystals. 

The bracelet measures 1.5" wide and 7.5" long. 

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

name: "Bermuda" - Labradorite, Iolite and Titanium-Coated Drusy Agate Necklace
description:
A unique combination of gemstones was put together to create a unique pendant design. In the mix there is Labradorite, Iolite and Titanium-Coated Drusy Agate, all in various shades of beautiful, iridescent blues reminiscent of the deep blue waters surrounding the Bermuda Islands. Encased in sterling silver, the pendant measures 73mm (approx. 2 7/8") in length (including the bail) and 1 1/4" at its widest point.  The weight of the pendant including the gemstones is 19.1g (approx. 0.67oz). The stones are flawlessly cut and polished and the combination of shapes, colors and textures is gorgeous in every way! 

The pendant is hanging on a hard sterling silver (solid 925, marked) neck wire. The v-shape of the neck wire wraps without flaw around the neck and measures 6 1/4" from the clasp down to where it meets the pendant, and 5 1/2" across, for a total circumference of 18". The width of it is 5mm, and it weighs 20g (approx. 0.70oz). 

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

Considered "The Stone of Spiritual Awakening", labradorite gets its name from the region Labrador in Canada which is the main and original source of this feldspar stone. Even before the year 1000, the natives of Maine used this gem for decoration. However, it was only in the 1770s that the labradorite got its name, when it was found by Moravian Missionaries in Labrador.  Said to represent the "temple of the stars" , it brings clarity of thought, and the wisdom of other worlds and universes to us.  On an individual level, it brings forth each person's strengths to share with the world, and each other.

Named from the Greek "ios", or violet, Iolite is a rich violet blue gemstone that might remind you of better-known gems like tanzanite and sapphire. Although it is still not well known, iolite has a long history.

When Leif Eriksson and the other legendary Viking explorers ventured far into the Atlantic, away from any coastline that could help them determine position, they relied on iolite to help them determine their location. They used thin pieces of iolite as the world's first polarizing filter. Looking through an iolite lens, they could determine the exact position of the sun, and navigate safely to the new world and back.

The property that made iolite so valuable to the Vikings is extreme pleochroism. Iolite has different colors in different directions in the crystal. A cube cut from iolite will look a violetish blue almost like sapphire from one side, clear as water from the other, and a honey yellow from the top. This property led some people to call iolite "water sapphire" in the past, a name that is now obsolete.

Iolite is mined in India, Sri Lanka, Mozambique, Zimbabwe, and Brazil. The Vikings probably mined iolite from deposits in Norway and Greenland. 

Iolite is relatively hard, with a Mohs Hardness of 7 to 7.5, but should be protected from blows. Clean with mild dish soap: use a toothbrush to scrub behind the stone where dust can collect.

The pearl is moving freely on the face of a 28mm (approx. 1 1/4") 14K gold-plated brass round  that was hammered and curved for a multidimensional finish.  

Being an organic gem created over a long period of time by a living organism, the pearls have slight imperfections that only enhance their beauty. I personally love those imperfections as they remind me of how imperfect I am.  

14K gold-plated french hook style ear wires. 

Overall length of the earring is 45mm (approx. 1 3/4"). 

Total weight for the pair is 11g (approx. 0.4oz) or 5.5g (approx. 0.2) per earring. Each pearl has a carat weight of approx. 8ct (1ct=200mg).

Pearl is the official birthstone for the month of June as adopted by the American National Association of Jewelers in 1912. It is also the birthstone for the Sun Signs of Gemini and Cancer.

name: Cubic Zirconia and 14K Gold-Filled Earrings
description:
Elegant. Classic. Perfect.  Bezel-set cubic zirconia drops (12x18mm) in a unique "black diamond" color are elegantly framed in 14K gold-fill with a rope design and set in a durable three prong mounting. The drops hang from 8x10mm cubic zirconia rectangles of similar color that add length and dimension to the overall look of the earring. Flawlessly cut and faceted, the stones capture and reflect the light from all angles in soft hues of grays and greens. 

Hand-forged 14K golld-filled ear wires, hammered for added strength and texture. 

Overall length of the earring is 46mm (approx. 1 3/4").

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

Gold-filled is an actual layer of gold-pressure bonded to another metal.  Gold-filled is not to be confused with gold plating as filled literally has 100% more gold than gold plating.  Gold-filled is much more valuable and tarnish resistant.  It does not flake off, rub off or turn colors.  As a matter of fact, anyone who can wear gold can wear gold-filled without worries of any allergic reaction to the jewelry.  Gold-filled jewelry is an economical alternative to solid gold!

Gold-filled items are regulated by the government.  These items are therefore so much better then gold-plated which has no regulations at all.  Gold-filled jewelry is made from solid gold and filled with other alloys such as rhodium (a member of the platinum family), brass, and sterling silver.  Gold-filled wears, looks and lasts like solid gold because its outer surface IS solid gold.  Everything you can see and touch is pure gold.  In the jewelry industry the quantity of gold must be at least 1/20th by weight of the total product.

Gold-filled items are generally considered lifetime products, and the gold layer will not wear off, as it will in electroplated products.  Gold-filled jewelry is often called the wave of the future because it offers all the same characteristics as solid gold such as strength, durability and beauty….but at a fraction of the cost!

Caring for Gold Filled items is as easy as caring for any gold jewelry. Simply keep away from chemicals, clean regularly with mildly sudsy water, rinse well and pat dry with a non-scratching cloth. Polish gently with a jewelry polishing cloth.

name: "Larissa Mar" - Larimar, Rainbow Moonstone and Pearl Necklace
description:
Feel the calm, deep blue of glowing Larimar! Perfectly paired with Rainbow Moonstone and a large ivory freshwater pearl, the Larimar in this unique pendant is polished to perfection and glows in soft, muted shades of blue like those of the tropical waters of the Caribbean. 

Encased in sterling silver (marked 925), the pendant measures 3 1/8" (approx. 80mm) in length (including the bail) and 1" (approx. 25mm) at its widest point. The weight of the pendant including the gemstones is 20.3g (approx. 0.72oz). The stones are flawlessly cut and polished and the combination of shapes, colors and textures is gorgeous in every way! 

The pendant is hanging on a hard sterling silver (solid 925, marked) neck wire. The v-shape of the neck wire wraps without flaw around the neck and measures 6 1/4" from the clasp down to where it meets the pendant, and 5 1/2" across, for a total circumference of 18". The width of it is 5mm, and it weighs 20g (approx. 0.70oz).

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

Gemstone Info:  Considered to be extremely rare, Larimar is a beautiful gemstone that is only found in one location: a mountainous, relatively inaccessible area in the province of Barahona in the Dominican Republic. The first mention of the stone is in a request to mine Larimar in 1916, however it wasn't until 1974 that the stone really made an appearance. Recognized by its blue color very similar to that of the tropical beach water, Larimar stones are thought to have formed years ago as a result of volcanic eruptions. It is theorized that as magma was forced from beneath the earth’s surface, it mixed with a variety of substances such as aluminum compounds, sodium, calcium and iron. This chemical mixture formed into what is known in geology as a pectolite that is essentially a mineral occurring in radiated or fibrous or crystalline masses. This is the cause for its unusual but beautiful bright blue color.

The gemstone was given its name by Miguel Mendez, a Dominican who discovered an abandoned gemstone mine in the southwestern part of the country around 1974. The word Larimar was created by combining the beginning of Mendez’s daughter’s name Larissa with the word “mar” which is the Spanish word for sea. Strangely enough, despite being in existence for so long, up until that point the largely ignored gemstone had not been officially named and the name “Larimar” stuck.

Because Larimar is indigenous to the Dominican Republic and because of its unusual beauty, there is naturally a lot of Dominican folklore surrounding it. It is often looked upon as a powerful, spiritual stone. It is said to soothe, heal and enlighten. It is supposed to enable one to view things from a different perspective. The stone itself represents peace, clarity and love and is recommended for people who are stressed. This is all undoubtedly due to its tranquil blue color.

Agate derives its name from the river Achates in Sicily. Greek philosophers indicate as early as 300BC that the name of the gemstone achates (agate) was based on the source of such stones from this river.  It was the stone of warriors in ancient times.  The famous ancient Egyptian scarabs are made of agate.  

Agates come in many forms and colors and are among the earliest stones used for healing and bringing good luck.  Agate is the must-have protection stone. It protects from stress, from bad dreams and is said to protect children from danger. It enables the wearer to distinguish between false friends and true ones. It brings prosperity and creates an appreciation of nature.  

Like all black stones, Black Agate protects against negative energies, it attracts good fortune and promotes goodwill, helps to overcome fears and brings strength.  (Information provided through www.friendlycrystals.com.  Thank you!)

Gold-filled jewelry is made from solid gold and filled with other alloys such as rhodium (a member of the platinum family), brass, and sterling silver. name: "Passion" - Mozambique Garnet, Sediment Jasper and Mystic Topaz Necklace
description:
A very emotionally intense color, red is the color of fire so it is associated with energy, strength, power, determination, as well as passion, desire, and love.

Inspired by the life-giving powers of the color red, a unique combination of gemstones was put together to create a unique pendant design. In the mix there is Mozambique Garnet, Red Sea Sediment Jasper and Mystic Topaz, all in various shades of beautiful, iridescent reds. Encased in sterling silver, the pendant measures 80mm (approx. 3 1/8") in length (including the bail) and 34mm (approx. 1 3/8") at its widest point.  The weight of the pendant including the gemstones is 22.6g (approx. 0.80oz). The stones are flawlessly cut and polished and the combination of shapes, colors and textures is gorgeous in every way! 

The pendant is hanging on a hard sterling silver (solid 925, marked) neck wire. The v-shape of the neck wire wraps without flaw around the neck and measures 6 1/4" from the clasp down to where it meets the pendant, and 5 1/2" across, for a total circumference of 18". The gemstone Garnet is the official birthstone for January as adopted by the American National Association of Jewelers in 1912. It is also the stone for the Zodiac sign Aquarius. 

Garnets range from a 7.0 to 7.5 on the Mohs scale of hardness and are found in the U.S. (Arizona), South Africa, Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Myanmar (Burma), Mozambique, Scotland, Switzerland and Tanzania. They form under high temperatures and/or pressure and geologists often use garnets as a gauge of the amount of temperature and pressure that was present during their formation. 

Folklore, Legend, and Healing Properties: Garnet's powers include healing, strength, and protection and it is often worn to relieve inflammations of the skin. It is also believed to regulate the heart and blood flow and aid in curing depression. In earlier times, garnets were exchanged as gifts between friends to demonstrate their affection for each other and to insure that they meet again.

Jasper was a favorite gem in ancient times and is referenced in Hebrew, Assyrian and Latin literature. It is a fine-grained chalcedony and comes in all colors. The name jasper comes from the Greek and means "spotted stone." Found in many varieties and colors, Sea Sediment Jasper is a wonderful stone for helping one find inner peace, clarity, love and compassion, helps with the alignment of the physical and "Light" bodies and is an excellent stone for emotional healing.

Shimmering with the light of a thousand rainbows, Mystic Topaz is a relatively new type of enhanced gemstone, but its unique multicolored brilliance is making it one of the most sought after gems of today.  To create mystic topaz, high-quality natural colourless topaz is treated with a thin coating of titanium which is applied to the underside of the stone. It is the application of this coating that creates the stunning rainbow colours from blue, green and yellow to small bursts of red shades. This striking iridescent effect makes mystic topaz the perfect choice for unique jewelry.

name: Black Onyx Drop Earrings
description:
For those who prefer the color black, here is a pair of earrings that goes well with pretty much every clothing article you have in your wardrobe.  Multi-circle abstract shape connectors, 18K gold-plated in a soft satin finish and studded with clear cubic zirconia, melt into a bezel-set onyx drop (12x18mm) that dangles playfully as it reflects the light with every facet.

18K GP french hook style ear wires. 

Overall length of the earring is 60mm (approx. 2 3/8").

Onyx is one of the gemstones associated with the month of December and with the zodiac sign of Leo. 

History and Lore: The name Onyx is a derivation of the Greek word 'onux', meaning "fingernail". Legend says that a sleeping Venus had her divine fingernails cut off with an arrowhead by Eros/Cupid. He left the clippings scattered on the sand below, which later turned to stone because the gods felt that no part of Venus' heavenly body should ever perish. 

Originally, in Greek times, almost all colors of Chalcedony from white to dark brown and black were labeled as Onyx. It was then later decided by the Ancient Romans that the term Onyx would only be used refer to the black and dark brown colored stones. 

The Ancient Romans associated Onyx with courage and it was thought to be useful when defending oneself against criticism. It also is thought to have protective qualities, particularly when traveling. It is believed to bring about spiritual inspiration and assist with keeping emotions and passions under control. It is also believed to help the wearer to change bad habits. 

Physically Onyx is believed to strengthen the heart, kidneys, nerves, hair, eyes and nails. It is also believed to relieve stress and neurological disorders and to aid sleep. (Information obtained through www.gemtradenet.com. Thank you!)

name: "Aara" - Cyan Banded Agate and Tibetan Silver Bracelet
description:
Casual yet sophisticated, this beautiful bracelet tranforms any time into a special event. Handcrafted with gemstones, Swarovski crystals and Tibetan silver components, it features a 28x37mm oval banded agate centerpiece in a beautiful cyan color, framed by interwoven twisted rings and lilac Swarovski crystals that enhance the colorful swirls in the agate. The design is completed by Tibetan silver tube beads with flower carvings detail, that are flared at the edges for a multidimensional finish. Two tiny cloudy aquamarine rondelles at the ends add a drop of color on each side of the closure.  

The bracelet measures 8" in length and 1 1/4" at its widest point.

Handcrafted.

* Aara is a Persian name meaning Adoring

Agate is the Mystical birthstone for September. It is also the birthstone for the Zodiac sign of Gemini.

Agate is a variety of chalcedony formed from layers of quartz which usually show varicolored bands, hence the name "banded agate". It usually occurs as rounded nodules or veins. A hard stone, usually within the range of 7-9 on the Mohs scale, agates are in all colors of the rainbow, although green and blue are quite rare. Agate is found all over the world including: the Africa, Asia, Brazil, Egypt, Germany, India, Italy, Mexico, Nepal, and the USA.

Folklore, Legend, and Healing Properties:

Agate is believed to discern truth, accept circumstances, and is a powerful emotional healer. Legend says that Agate improves memory and concentration, increases stamina and encourages honesty. Agate is said to be particularly beneficial to people born under the sign of Gemini as it helps them to remain calm and focused

It is believed to prevent insomnia and insure pleasant dreams, to enhance personal courage and protect one against danger. Agate provides a calming influence, improves perception, concentration and helps to develop and increase one's analytical talents.

name: Rutilated Quartz and 14K Gold-Plated Brass Earrings
description:
Very elegant, this unique pair of earrings features marquise-shaped rutilated quartz drops in a pale shade of coral pink, measuring approx. 9x30mm. Translucent, the drops are beautifully faceted and have needle-like inclusions that only enhance the appearance of the stone, making it more interesting. The design is completed by a textured gold-plated brass component with an intricate swirl pattern from which the quartz drops hang.  

14K gold-plated french hook style ear wires.  

The overall length of the earring is 64mm (approx. 2 1/2").  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

Quartz is the most common mineral on Earth. It is found in nearly every geological environment and is a component of almost every rock type.  It makes up about 12% of the earth's crust, occurring in a wide variety of igneous, metamorphic and sedimentary rocks. Rutile is a major ore of titanium, which is a metal used for high tech alloys. It often forms needle-like crystal inclusions inside quartz.  This form of quartz is known as rutilated quartz and it looks like small bars of imbedded sharp crystals.  Rutile is a 6 on the Mohs scale.  Rutilated quartz is found in Australia, Brazil, Kazakhstan, Madagascar, Norway, Pakistan and the United States.

The name quartz comes from the Saxon word querklufterz which meant cross vein ore, and the name rutile comes from the Latin word rutilus meaning red.  Rutilated quartz has been referred to as Cupid's darts, Venus hair stone and Fleches d'amour.

Folklore, Legend, and Healing Properties:

Rutile is said to intensify the metaphysical properties of its host crystal and to enhance one's understanding of difficult situations. It is also said to enhance creativity and to relieve depression and loneliness.

Rutilated quartz is said to slow down the aging process and to be a strong healer. Also, it is said that it brings forth each person's strengths, originality, aids sleep, relate to others.

Legend says that a piece of this variety of quartz could be used as a key to unlocking the spiritual world and allowing the wearer to see into it. It offers clarity of mind and decision-making which brings about good fortune.

Aquamarine is the birthstone for the month of March and is associated with the zodiac sign of Pisces. 

History and Lore: The name Aquamarine was derived by the Latin words, aqua meaning water, and mare meaning sea. This is because of its colors close resemblance to sea water. Aquamarine was considered sacred to the god of the sea, Neptune. It is documented that it was used by the Greeks between 480-300 BC. They would wear Aquamarine amulets engraved with the water god Poseidon to protect them against perils and monsters of the sea. Legend also says that Aquamarine was the treasure of the mermaids and for this reason, sailors would wear it to keep them safe on voyages out to sea and prevent seasickness. 

Aquamarine is also said to have a soothing effect on married couples, helping husbands and wives work out their differences and ensure a long and happy marriage. Additionally, it is said that Aquamarine will provide its wearer with everlasting youth and happiness, provide courage, cure laziness and quicken the intellect. 

Aquamarine can replace anger and negativity with mental peace and clarity, providing the wearer with emotional and mental balance. For these reasons it is said to be an effective treatment for anxiety. 

Aquamarine is an effective gemstone for opening the fifth chakra, the throat chakra. Water in which an Aquamarine has been immersed can cure eye problems, swollen glands and helps to maintain healthy teeth and gums. (Information provided through www.gemtradenet.com. Thank you.)

description:

Set in sterling silver and measuring 1 1/2" (approx. 38mm) long and 3/4" (approx. 18mm) wide, the flawlessly faceted citrine featured in this exotic pendant is sure to draw a lot of attention! Two strands of high-quality, high-lustre ivory pearls (6-7mm), and a round sterling silver spring clasp (18mm) that closes in the front complete the design.

By removing the pendant you can have a completely different necklace, a simple, classy two-strands of pearls which can be worn either with the clasp asymmetrically on one side, or with it concealed in the back.  Overall length of the necklace is 18" (approx. 46cm) - add 1 1/2" (approx. 38mm) for the pendant.  

The earrings are simple, meant to just complete the set and not take away from the dramatic effect of the necklace.  They feature shimmering citrine teardrops, also faceted, and a single lustrous freshwater pearl (approx. 6mm) accented by a Swarovski crystal rondelle for added sparkle.  The sterling silver ear wires are studded with clear cubic zirconia.  Overall length of the earring is 1 7/8" (approx. 48mm). 

Total weight for the pair is 8.2g (approx. 0.29oz) or 4.1g (approx.0.14oz) per earring. Each citrine drop has a carat weight of approx.16.5ct (1ct=200mg) for a total carat weight of the citrine of 33ct.

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

The gemstone Citrine is named after the French word "citron", meaning lemon. The color of citrine ranges from straw and sun yellow, to clay orange, to deep wine colored Madeira red, and like all crystal quartz it has a hardness of 7 on the Mohs scale which makes it insensitive to scratches.  It is the official birthstone for the month of November as adopted by the American National Association of Jewelers in 1912, and it is also considered the Planetary stone for the Sun Sign of Virgo.

Citrine is considered to bring happiness, joy and optimism, and it is one of only two minerals on the planet which do not hold or accumulate negative energy, but dispels and transforms it. Citrine energizes and  invigorates, promotes warmth, comfort, and energy.

name: Golden Pyrite Nuggets and Sterling Silver Earrings
description:
Lightweight and elegant, this unique pair of earrings features 10x10mm golden pyrite freeform nuggets brightly polished on three sides and irregularly sculpted on the fourth (front) side to reveal the crystals within the stone, as if just broken from a bigger block. The pyrite is beautifully shimmering with golden flashes as the light brushes its surface. Tiny pyrite rounds and sterling silver components complete the design. 

The custom oversized sterling silver ear wires measure 30mm in length and are hammered for added strength and texture. 

Overall length of the earring is 45mm (approx. 1 3/4"). 

Total weight for the pair is 12g (approx. 0.4oz) or 6g (approx. 0.2oz) per earring. Each stone has a carat weight of approx. 20ct (1ct=200mg). 

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

A very interesting and attractive gemstone, Pyrite is a fairly common stone that can be found practically all over the world. Also called "Fool's Gold", it is a distinctly golden colored mineral that contains a mixture of iron and sulfur. 

Pyrite has been known to man since ancient times and gets its name from the Greek word "Pyr", which means fire, probably referring to the stone's ability to spark when struck with steel. 

The resemblance of pyrite to gold has made it a traditional symbol for money and good luck. Its golden color associates it with the sun, and with fortification and strengthening of the mind. Iron Pyrite makes a wonderful energy shield, blocking out negativity, and it is known to enhance energy, vitality and confidence.

name: Freshwater Pearl and Red Coral Tibetan Style Earrings
description:
Very much in line with today's fashion trends inclining toward tribal influences, this unique pair of earrings features beautiful Tibetan style beads handcrafted by Nepalese artisans.  

Measuring 12x25mm, these artful beads were crafted by artisan families from Katmandu (Nepal) using freeform natural pearls surrounded by masterfully carved antiqued pewter cones. The snow-white color of the pearl is vividly contrasted by a tiny coral accent in a bright red shade discreetly placed at the very bottom of the earring.  

These families are highly skilled and have been crafting ethnic beads and jewelry for many generations.  Due to their handcrafted nature, no two beads are alike. 

Sterling silver french hook style ear wires.  

Overall length of the earring is 38mm (approx. 1 1/2").  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

name: Natural Seafoam Green Chalcedony and Vermeil Earrings
description:
Elegant.  Clasic.  Perfect.  Natural faceted seafoam-green chalcedony briolettes are elegantly framed in vermeil (gold over sterling silver) and hang from 14K gold-filled small hoops adorned with clear cubic zirconia set in durable four prong mountings.  The hoops have a snap closure and measure 10mm in diameter and 5mm wide.  

Overall length of the earring is 40mm (approx. 1 1/2").  

Handcrafted - One of a kind. 

Chalcedony is any form of microcrystalline or cryptocrystalline quartz, meaning any form of quartz with crystals that are too small to be seen without high magnification. In common practice, only the translucent, single color types are sold as "chalcedony", whereas the rest of this group is sold under individual variety names, such as agate, carnelian, bloodstone, jasper or onyx. 

Chalcedony is named after the ancient seaport of Chalcedon (Kardikoy, Turkey).  Considered a sacred stone by the Native American Indians, chalcedony nurtures and promotes brotherhood and good will, brings peace and maintains harmony between people.

name: Styles of the Modern Era - Victorian Pearl Earrings
description:
According to style experts worldwide, the trend in jewelry design this year is marked by the return of the vintage victorian look inspired by the natural world.  Taking a cue from royal jewelry, this elegant pair of earrings has both the victorian look and the natural element as represented by the antiqued silver maple leaf with an intricate marcasite-like design. And what better gem to complement this look than a big (14mm), bold, perfectly round, irridescent black shell pearl.

Sterling silver french hook style ear wires.  

Overall length of the earring is  60mm (approx. 2 3/8").  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

The shell pearl is made from mother of pearls, the hard inner layer of the shell of an oyster. The process of making a shell pearl involves several different stages. 

The raw material for the base of the pearl is the sea shell, which is then cut, rounded, shaped, drilled and strung.  The pearls thus formed are later framed and dyed in various shades.  After the pearls are baked and polished, they receive their final stringing. 

In order to produce a good quality pearl, a key ingredient is what is called a 'mother of pearl bead'. This element adds weight, value and durability to the pearl. In fact, the materials used in order to make shell pearls are the same materials from which cultured pearls are made.

name: Kambaba Jasper Earrings
description:
With its rich patterns of green like the cool mossy forest floor, this rare stone has orbicular patterns of dark green and black swirling on a contrasting lighter green background. Although its history is very controversial, many gemologists agree today that Kambaba Jasper (also called Crocodile Jasper) is a rare fossilized jasper from Madagascar, more precisely a Stromatolite Jasper, which means that it is composed of fossilized algae.  Stromatolites, colonial structures created by Cyanobacteria (commonly called blue-green algae) are among the oldest fossils on earth, being found in rocks over 3 billion years old.  Fossil Stromatolites constitute our earliest and most pervasive record of life on Earth. 

Green is the color of growth, renewal and prosperity, a color of elegance and beauty that enhances our sense of well-being, balance and harmony. Featuring a trapezoidal cut and polished to perfection, the stones measure 25mm (approx. 1") in length and 23mm (approx. 7/8") at their widest point. A narrow band of raw brass hammered for added texture, wraps around the stones to create a stunning visual effect.

14K gold-plated french hook style ear wires. 

The overall length of the earring is 50mm (approx. 2").

For those who fear that the earrings might be too heavy, the total weight for the pair is 12g (approx. 0.4oz) or 6g (approx. 0.2oz) per earring.

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

name: "Black Gold" - Black Spinel, Pyrite and Sterling Silver Earrings
description:
Very elegant, this unique pair of earrings features natural faceted black spinel teardrops (12x20mm) and a smaller freeform golden pyrite nugget from which the custom oversized sterling silver ear wire emerges.  The ear wires are gently hammered for added strength.  

Overall length of the earring is 45mm (approx. 1 3/4").  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

History & Lore:  It is not known for certain how the name Spinel originated. The most common suggestion is that it may have derived from the Latin word 'spina' meaning a thorn, possibly referring to its fiery color or the sharp pointed crystals that are found within some Spinels. Spinels were often referred to as 'balas rubies' in ancient times. 'Balas' or 'Balascia' is a territory in Northern Afghanistan known as Badakshan where Spinels may have first been discovered. This area in the Middle Ages was an active gem-producing region that had discovered large beautiful red to pink Spinels that were thought to be rubies and considered the best rubies of their time.

Many royal crown jewels thought to be rubies have actually turned out to be red Spinels. The Black Prince's Ruby on the British Imperial State Crown is a 170-carat red Spinel. The Timor Ruby that has the engraved names of the Mogul emperors on its face was once thought to be a Ruby as well. This magnificent 352-carat stone is in fact a red Spinel and is now owned by Queen Elizabeth.

Spinels are associated with love and help the wearer to put their ego aside and become devoted to another person. Spinel also encourages passion and is said to increase the duration of one's life.

Black Spinel in particular is said to be a protective stone and helps re-establish relationships and resolve issues. It is also believed to relieve sadness. (Information provided through www.gemtradenet.com)

name: Amber Swarovski Crystal and 14K Gold-Fill Earrings/Necklace/Set
description:
Beautiful cube-shaped Swarovski crystals (8x8x8mm) in a vibrant amber color are eye-catching on this delicate necklace and earrings set.  Flawlessly cut and faceted, the crystals capture the light from all angles reflecting it in soft hues of golds and browns as if looking through a glass filled with old, vintage quality cognac, and are enhanced by 14K gold-plated Swarovski studded spacer squares that sparkle beautifully.  

Choose between Earrings, Necklace, or both pieces as a Set for a greater value:
Earrings - $32.99
Necklace - $32.99
Set - $57.99

The necklace features a very delicate pendant with a single crystal framed on each side by spacer squares and tiny golden bicones.  The pendant hangs from 14K gold-filled chain that closes with a delicate lobster clasp.  Overall length of the necklace is 18”. 

The earrings replicate the pendant design and hang from hand-forged oversized 14K gold-fill ear wires that are hammered for added strength and texture.  Overall length of the earring is 2 1/8" (approx. 53mm).

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

Swarovski (Austrian) Crystal is considered to be of finest quality,  unmatched in clarity and distinction. When Daniel Swarovski first brought a sparkle to crystal over a hundred years ago, he could have never imagined what a development he was setting in motion. With fantasy, intuition and technical finesse, he managed to expose all the facets hidden within this fascinating material. 

Today, sparkling Crystal Components in thousands of colors, shapes and sizes provide a fantastic palette of inspiration for designers and manufacturers.

description:
Great value on this elegant choker necklace.  It features a 50mm Swarovski De-Art Crystal Silver Shade pendant which is faceted and captures the light from every angle, sparkling beautifully.  

The pendant is set on a bail also studded with clear crystals, and is hanging on a hard sterling silver (solid 925, marked) neck wire. The round shape of the neck wire wraps without flaw around the neck and measures 6 1/4" from the clasp down to where it meets the pendant, and 5 1/2" across, for a total circumference of 18". The width of it is 4mm, and together with the bail it weighs 20g (approx. 0.70oz). 

Swarovski (Austrian) Crystal is considered to be of finest quality, unmatched in clarity and distinction. When Daniel Swarovski first brought a sparkle to crystal over a hundred years ago, he could have never imagined what a development he was setting in motion. With fantasy, intuition and technical finesse, he managed to expose all the facets hidden within this fascinating material.

Today, sparkling Crystal Components in thousands of colors, shapes and sizes provide a fantastic palette of inspiration for designers and manufacturers.

Handcrafted - one of a kind.

name: "Moonlight" - Natural Faceted Aquamarine and Silver Necklace
description:
This beautiful aquamarine neclace is a perfect accesory for any occasion.  Your eyes will definitely light up when you see how well the sophisticated necklace complements your outfit.  Wear it with jeans or with your favorite dress and just enjoy the compliments that will keep coming.  

The necklace features faceted aquamarine freeform nuggets (approx. 15x15mm) in a soft, almost translucent blue color, reminiscent of the light on a night with full moon. The design is completed by square silver-plated accents (also measuring 15x15mm).  The square toggle clasp closes on the side and has a tiny aquamarine drop hanging from a short chain linked to it.  Overall length of the necklace is 20".  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.   

Aquamarine is the birthstone for the month of March and is associated with the zodiac sign of Pisces.  

The name Aquamarine was derived by the Latin words, aqua meaning “water”, and mare meaning “sea”. This is because of its color's close resemblance to sea water.  Aquamarine was considered sacred to the god of the sea, Neptune. It is documented that it was used by the Greeks between 480-300 BC. They would wear Aquamarine amulets engraved with the water god Poseidon to protect them against perils and monsters of the sea.  Legend also says that Aquamarine was the treasure of the mermaids and for this reason, sailors would wear it to keep them safe on voyages out to sea and prevent seasickness.

Aquamarine is also said to have a soothing effect on married couples, helping husbands and wives work out their differences and ensure a long and happy marriage.

Additionally, it is said that Aquamarine will provide its wearer with everlasting youth and happiness, provide courage, cure laziness and quicken the intellect. Aquamarine can replace anger and negativity with mental peace and clarity, providing the wearer with emotional and mental balance. For these reasons it is said to be an effective treatment for anxiety. 

Aquamarine is an effective gemstone for opening the fifth chakra, the throat chakra. Water in which an Aquamarine has been immersed can cure eye problems, swollen glands and helps to maintain healthy teeth and gums.  (Information provided through www.gemtradenet.com.  Thank you.)

name: Lapis Lazuli, Pearl and 14K Gold-Fill Earrings
description:
A very elegant stone, Lapis Lazuli has been used in jewelry-making for over 7000 years, and even though it is considered to be one of the oldest gemstones used for jewelry it still remains popular today. 

This pair of earrings features incredibly beautiful Lapis teardrop beads (14x20mm) in a deep indigo color, polished to perfection, with muted golden pyrite intrusions that add to the overall dimension. Tiny, delicate white pearls wrapped in 14K gold-fill accentuate the stone and simple french-style hook ear wires complete the design.  

Overall leagth of the earring is 1 5/8" (approx. 42mm).  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

Known for its blue color, Lapis Lazuli has been a highly valued stone for many thousands of years. The Latin "lapis" meaning stone, and the word "lazuli" coming from the Persian/Arabic lazhward or blue (as in "azure") were put together to create a name that means "blue stone" or stone of azure.  

Lapis Lazuli is rare and only found in only a few places including Chile, Baffin Islands, United States, Siberia, and Afghanistan, where it occurs in large deposits. 

Lapis has always been fashioned as beads and cabochons, carved into exquisite articles of ornament, or used in inlays and mosaics. In Egypt and Sumeria it was ground and used as eye shadow, or set in protective amulets and other jewelry. Romans ingested the ground lapis powder in food and drink as an aphrodisiac and as an antidote to poison.  

As an ancient gem, Lapis Lazuli has a facinating history.  This semi-precious mineral was usually used for artworks of great importance such as the funeral mask of Tutankhamun and the decoration of the Taj Mahal.  It was said to be the stone of rulers and to represent power, and some ancient cultures actually valued Lapis Lazuli as much as or more than gold.  

Lapis Lazuli was believed to give good judgement and insight, enhance wisdom, and stimulate inner vision and promote peace of mind.  It was also believed by some that wearing Lapis Lazuli would protect the wearer from evil. A saying of the ancient Sumerian priests states. "He who carries with him into battle an amulet of Lapis carries with him the presence of his god." Legend tells that the 10 Commandments were carved on stones of Lapis Lazuli.

name: Freshwater Pearl and Oxidized Copper Earrings
description:
Earthy yet elegant, this modern pair of earrings features teardrop-shaped freshwater pearls in a vibrant bronze color hanging from a textured copper element (1x1") with a square spiral design.  The Spiral, which is the oldest symbol known to be used in spiritual practices, reflects the universal pattern of growth and evolution. It is a sacred symbol that reminds us of our evolving journey in life. 

Pearls come in a bewildering variety of shapes, colors and sizes. Round pearls traditionally command the highest prices but it's worth remembering that wild pearls are rarely round.  Possessing a whimsical charm entirely different to the perfectly shaped pearls, the freeform pearls in this pair of earrings blend in the overall design, adding a nonconventional, rebelious flair to it.  

A beeswax-based green patina was added to the copper element to create an oxidized, weathered look. Four tiny Miyuki beads in a vibrant teal color complete the look, adding more contrast and playfulness to the overall design.   

Antiqued copper french hook style ear wires.  

Overall length of the earing is 2 5/8" (approx. 67mm).  

Total weight for the pair is 12g (approx. 0.4oz) or 6g (approx. 0.2oz) per earring.  Each pearl has a carat weight of approx. 8ct (1ct=200mg).

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

name: Heliotrope Swarovski Crystal and Vermeil Earrings
description:
The 12mm heliotrope Swarovski crystals featured in this design flash blue, purple and pink colors with a captivating sparkle that give this pair of earrings a "Wow!" factor.  The crystals have single-sided foil backing that creates an incredible reflective intensity, and the multiple facets angled in a very special way increase this effect when they catch the light.  

Heliotrope is a pink-purple tint that is a representation of the color of the heliotrope flower.  The name "heliotrope" derives from the old idea that the inflorescences of these plants turned their flowers to the sun (Helios is Greek for "sun", tropein means "to turn"). 

Hanging from 20mm vermeil open circles (vermeil = gold over sterling silver) brushed for a more dramatic visual effect, the crystals, like their flower namesake, will turn to the light and will reflect it back in a dizzying array of tiny rainbows.  

14K gold plated french hook style ear wires.  

Overall lenght of the earring is 50mm (approx. 2").  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

name: Madeira Citrine and Sterling Silver Earrings
description:
This classy pair of earrings features hand-cut marquise shaped Madeira Citrine drops (8x12mm) dangling inside open marquise shaped twisted sterling silver wire.  Citrine is named after the French word "citron", meaning lemon. The color of citrine ranges from straw and sun yellow, to clay orange, to deep wine colored Madeira red. The darker colors are considered more valuable, including  the Madeira variety.   

The custom oversized (30mm or approx. 1 3/16") sterling silver ear wires are hammered for added texture.  

Overall length of the earring is 50mm (approx. 2").  

The gemstone Citrine is the official birthstone for the month of November as adopted by the American National Association of Jewelers in 1912.  It is also the Planetary stone for the Sun Sign of Virgo and the accepted gem for the 13th and 17th wedding anniversary.  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

description:
Lightweight and elegant, this classic pair of earrings features 18mm pyrite coins polished to perfection, shimmering with golden flashes as the light brushes their surface.  Tiny pyrite rounds, sterling silver components, and sterling silver leverback ear wires complete the design.  

Overall length of the earring is 42mm (approx. 1 5/8").  

Total weight for the pair is 12g (approx. 0.4oz) or 6g (approx. 0.2oz) per earring.  Each stone has a carat weight of approx. 20ct (1ct=200mg).  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

A very interesting and attractive gemstone, Pyrite is a fairly common stone that can be found practically all over the world.  Also called "Fool's Gold", it is a distinctly golden colored mineral that contains a mixture of iron and sulfur. 

Pyrite has been known to man since ancient times and gets its name from the Greek word "Pyr", which means fire, probably referring to the stone's ability to spark when struck with steel.  

The resemblance of pyrite to gold has made it a traditional symbol for money and good luck. Its golden color associates it with the sun, and with fortification and strengthening of the mind. Iron Pyrite makes a wonderful energy shield, blocking out negativity, and it is known to enhance energy, vitality and confidence.

name: "Corona Australis" - Titanium-Coated Drusy Agate Necklace
description:
Named after a constellation in the Southern Hemisphere (its Latin name meaning "Southern Crown"), the pendant on this unique necklace features an oval drusy agate with a spectacular metallic titanium coating that catches the light beautifully, sparkling in all colors of the rainbow.  The design is completed by a peacock Biwa pearl, and four delicate Brazilian lavender amethyst, each with a different cut and facets.  Encased in solid sterling silver, the pendant measures  2 1/2" in length (including the bail) and       
1 3/4" at its widest point.  The weight of the pendant including the gemstones is 38g (or 1.1oz).

The pendant is hanging on a hard sterling silver (solid 925, marked) neck wire.  The v-shape of the neck wire wraps without flaw around the neck and measures 6 1/4" from the clasp down to where it meets the pendant, and 5 1/2" across, for a total circumference of 18".  The width of it is 5mm, and it weighs 25g (or 0.9oz).

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

Agate is the Mystical birthstone for September. It is also the birthstone for the Zodiac sign of Gemini.  

Drusy, druse, druzy, drusies - different spellings, but they all mean tiny quartz crystals that form within or on the surface of other stones.  When ground water carrying dissolved silica is forced into a porous area of the rock, rapid cooling often occurs, causing the formation of tiny crystals on the surfaces or in cavities of the rock. The clear crystals often form on top of previously deposited minerals. This is called a drusy.  

Titanium drusy is agate drusy that has been coated with titanium in a vacuum chamber. It produces a permanent metal coating in spectacular shades that are hard to reproduce in other ways. 

Agate is found all over the world including: the Africa, Asia, Brazil, Egypt, Germany, India, Italy, Mexico, Nepal, and the USA.  

History and Lore:  Agate is believed to discern truth, accept circumstances, and is a powerful emotional healer. Legend says that Agate improves memory and concentration, increases stamina and encourages honesty. 

Agate is said to be particularly beneficial to people born under the sign of Gemini as it helps them to remain calm and focused.  It is believed to prevent insomnia and insure pleasant dreams, to enhance personal courage and protect one against danger. 

Agate provides a calming influence, improves perception, concentration and helps to develop and increase one's analytical talents. 

(Information provided through www.bernardine.com.  Thank you!)

name: Oxidized Silver and Paua Shell Inlay Earrings
description:
The eye of the storm is captured in the swirling pattern of the beautiful paua shell inlays that adorn this unique pair of earrings.  Encased in  oxidized silver with a swirl and dot detail, the shells are changing color everytime they are viewed from a different angle.  Another feature that makes paua shells truly a nature's marvel is the fact that no two paua shells are the same. The patterns and colors vary from shell to shell.  The brilliant light that radiates from these shells and the amazing patterns in it come from the crystal layers that are created due to the protein and calcium in these shells. To bring out the real beauty of the Paua shells, they are first polished, before being used for making jewelry pieces.  

Sterling silver french hook style ear wires.  

Overall length o the earring is 55mm (approx. 2 1/4").  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

In the Maori language, paua is the name given to abalone (Haliotis Iris) species. Paua shellfish is only found in the coastal waters of New Zealand. On an average, a paua is around five inches in size and is mostly oval-shaped. There are two primary uses of paua. Firstly, it is harvested for its meat, which is considered a traditional Maori delicacy and secondly, the shells are used to make jewelry and other gift items.

Paua is sought-after sheer due to the vibrant, catchy and iridescent colors of its shell. If you look at the paua shells, they come in various kinds of colors and hues, right from green to blue to pink to purple to golden! 

Traditionally, these shells were used by the Maori people to highlight the eyes in their artwork. Usually, when it came to depicting rage in the eyes of the warriors, red paua shells were used. Many contemporary and traditional crafts of New Zealand have made extensive use of these shells.  (Information provided through www.buzzle.com.  Thank you!)

name: "Selene" - Titanium-Coated Drusy Agate Necklace
description:

The other three stones, smoky topaz, light peridot and golden citrine are reminiscent of the colors of the twilight changing gradually into the muted light of a sunrise. They were immortal huge beings of incredible strength and stamina and were also the first pantheon of Greco-Roman gods and goddesses.

Agate is the Mystical birthstone for September. It is also the birthstone for the Zodiac sign of Gemini.

name: Faceted Aquamarine Briolette Earrings
description:
Faceted aquamarine briolette drops (8mm) in soft, muted tones of twilight sway beneath stacked copper rings of various sizes. 

Copper french hook style ear wire.

Aquamarine was considered sacred to the god of the sea, Neptune. It is documented that it was used by the Greeks between 480-300 BC. They would wear Aquamarine amulets engraved with the water god Poseidon to protect them against perils and monsters of the sea.  Legend also says that Aquamarine was the treasure of the mermaids and for this reason, sailors would wear it to keep them safe on voyages out to sea and prevent seasickness.  

Aquamarine is also said to have a soothing effect on married couples, helping husbands and wives work out their differences and ensure a long and happy marriage.  Additionally, it is said that Aquamarine will provide its wearer with everlasting youth and happiness, provide courage, cure laziness and quicken the intellect. name: "Midnight" - Rutilated Quartz and Tibetan Silver Necklace
description:
Polished to perfections, the exotic rutilated quartz ovals (20x30mm) featured in this design are almost transparent and with needle-like crystal inclusions that create an intricate web inside the stone.  Paired with Tibetan silver carved beads, this necklace is sure to please even the most conservative tastes and will comlement pretty much  everything you have in your closet.  

A classic lobster-claw clasp with a 2" extension chain finishes the design.  

Overall length of the necklace is 19"plus the 2" extension chain (approx. 48cm plus 5cm ). 

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

Quartz is the most common mineral on Earth. It is found in nearly every geological environment and is a component of almost every rock type.  It makes up about 12% of the earth's crust, occurring in a wide variety of igneous, metamorphic and sedimentary rocks. It is also the most varied in terms of variety and color.  Quartz is a 7 on the Mohs scale of hardness.  The name quartz comes from the Saxon word querklufterz which meant cross vein ore. 

Rutile is a major ore of titanium, which is a metal used for high tech alloys. It often forms needle-like crystal inclusions inside quartz.  This form of quartz is known as rutilated quartz and it looks like small bars of imbedded crystals. 

Folklore, Legend, and Healing Properties:  Brings forth each person's strengths, originality, aids sleep, relate to others.  It is also said to enhance creativity and to relieve depression and loneliness. Rutilated Quartz is said to slow down the aging process and is said to be a strong healer.

name: Brazilian Purple Amethyst and Sterling Silver Earrings
description:
Delicate Brazilian amethyst drops in a vibrant purple color are eye-catching on this beautiful pair of earrings.  Amethyst is a violet variety of quartz, and is considered to be the traditional birthstone for February.  

The 6x12mm amethyst drops are faceted to capture the light from every angle and are dangling inside a sterling silver frame in the shape of a leaf.

Amethyst is the Birthstone for February. It is also the Zodiac stone for the constellation of Pisces. Amethyst is associated with spirituality, wisdom, sobriety, and security.

Fun Fact:  Amethyst was considered to be a strong antidote against drunkenness, which is why wine goblets were often carved from it.  

Mythology:  In Greek mythology, Dionysus, the god of wine, was pursuing a maiden named Amethystos, who refused his affections. Amethystos prayed to the gods to remain chaste, a prayer which the goddess Artemis answered by transforming her into a white stone.  Humbled by Amethystos's desire to remain chaste, Dionysus poured wine over the stone as an offering, dyeing the crystals purple.

And there is something about the lively combination between copper and blue that always lights my eyes.  So this is how I came up with this unique pair of earrings.  

Vibrant  jasper teardrops (10x16mm) with sedimentary inclusions that only make the stone more interesting are hanging from hand-hammered raw copper bars (5x20mm) that are slighly curved for added dimension.  

Copper french hook style ear wires.

Handcrafted - One of a kind.   

Sea Sediment Jasper is only one of the names for this absolutely gorgeous stone that is also referred to as: "Aqua Terra Jasper" (the blue and green colors), "Impression Jasper" (for it does make quite the impression), "Snakeskin Jasper", as well as "Variscite" and "Regalite". 

Jasper was a favorite gem in ancient times and is referenced in Hebrew, Assyrian and Latin literature. It is a fine-grained chalcedony and comes in all colors. The name jasper comes from the Greek and means "spotted stone". 

Aqua Terra (translated as Water and Earth) - the blue and green varieties of Sea Sediment Jasper is a wonderful stone for helping one find inner peace, clarity, love and compassion, helps with the alignment of the physical and "light" bodies and is an excellent stone for emotional healing. (Information provided through www.greenvalleyjewelry.com.  Thank you!)
