Agate derives its name from the river Achates in Sicily. Greek philosophers indicate as early as 300BC that the name of the gemstone achates (agate) was based on the source of such stones from this river.  It was the stone of warriors in ancient times.  The famous ancient Egyptian scarabs are made of agate.  

Agates come in many forms and colors and are among the earliest stones used for healing and bringing good luck.  Agate is the must-have protection stone. It protects from stress, from bad dreams and is said to protect children from danger. It enables the wearer to distinguish between false friends and true ones. It brings prosperity and creates an appreciation of nature.  

Like all black stones, Black Agate protects against negative energies, it attracts good fortune and promotes goodwill, helps to overcome fears and brings strength.  (Information provided through www.friendlycrystals.com.  Thank you!)

name: Rainbow Moonstone, Ruby and 14K Gold-Fill Earrings
description:
Like a perfect red rose, the Ruby's rich color speaks of love and passion.  Called the "Rajnapura" or "King of Gems" by ancient Hindus, July's birthstone is among the most highly prized of gems throughout history. The Ruby was considered to have magical powers, and was worn by royalty as a talisman against evil.  

This beautiful pair of earrings features faceted rainbow moonstone drops (approx. 10mm) accentuated by a cluster of three tiny ruby rondelles, also faceted.  The combination of the delicate, transparent moonstone and the fiery red of the ruby will grab everybody's attention for sure.  

The design is finished by custom oversized 14K gold-filled ear wires that measure 37mm (approx. 1.5") and are hammered for added texture and strength.  

Overall length of the earring is 53mm (approx. 2 1/8"). 

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

The word Ruby comes from the Latin "ruber," meaning red.  It is a variety of the mineral Corundum, and is found as crystals within metamorphic rock.  Corundum is the second hardest mineral, after Diamond.  It comes in a variety of colors, and is considered a Sapphire in any color except red, which is designated as a Ruby.  Rubies range in hue from an orangey red to a purplish red, but the most prized gems are a true red in color.  Large sized Rubies are very rare and valuable. 

The history of Ruby mining dates back more than 2,500 years ago.  The most beautiful crystals are thought to be from Burma, but quality Rubies are also found in India, Sri Lanka, Australia, Kenya, Tanzania, Afghanistan, Pakistan, and the United States. 

It has been said that the Ruby's red glow comes from an internal flame that cannot be extinguished, making a gift of this stone symbolic of everlasting love.  With its hardness and durability, it is a perfect engagement gem.  And if worn on the left hand, ancient lore has it that the Ruby will bring good fortune to its wearer, too!

Earthy yet elegant, this modern pair of earrings features uniquely shaped freshwater pearls in a vibrant bronze color hanging from textured copper chain links.  Pearls come in a bewildering variety of shapes, colors and sizes. Round pearls traditionally command the highest prices but it's worth remembering that wild pearls are rarely round.  Possessing a whimsical charm entirely different to the perfectly shaped pearls, the freeform pearls in this pair of earrings blend in the overall design, adding a nonconventional, rebelious flair to it.  

A beeswax-based green patina was added to the copper links to create an oxidized, weathered look.  

Copper ear wires.  

Overall length of the earing is 2 3/4" (approx. 70mm).  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

Sapphire is the official birthstone for the month of September as adopted by the American National Association of Jewelers in 1912. It is also one of the birth stones for the Zodiac signs of Pisces, Taurus, Virgo and Sagittarius. 

Sapphire is the non-red variety of corundum (the red variety of corundum is ruby). A 9.0 on the Mohs scale of hardness, sapphire is the second hardest natural mineral.  Blue is by far the most popular color for sapphires, but they can be almost any color, including yellow, green, white, colorless, pink, orange, brown, and purple. Padparadscha is the name for a rare orange-pink variety of sapphire and has a higher value than blue sapphires.  

History and Lore: Sapphire's powers include spiritual enlightenment and inner peace. It is believed to offer healing properties for rheumatism, colic, and mental illness. It is also considered an antidepressant and an aid to psychokinesis, telepathy, clairvoyance and astral projection.

description:
This beautiful pair of earrings features excellent quality larvikite squares (20x20mm or approx. 3/4x3/4") shining with flashes of blue and silver.  The colors change according to the angle of light refraction.

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

Larvikite is a lime rich Feldspar in which the sodium aluminum silicate and calcium aluminum silicate combine into a three way crystal system. This crystal formation contributes to the flashes found in Larvikite and other similar Feldspars like Labradorite and Rainbow Moonstone.  Most geologists believe this unique crystal is only found around the Fjords of Larvik Norway, hence the name Larvikite. 

Larvikite stones range in color from a lighter blue (Blue Pearl), to a darker blue with an almost steel colored flash (Emerald Pearl).  

While Larvikite's history is still pretty new (barely over 100 years), the gemstone has picked up a number of nicknames during this brief span. They include Birds Eye Granite, Black Moonstone, Blue Norwegian Moonstone, Blue Pearl Granite, Blue Granite, Norwegian Pearl Granite, Emerald Pearl, Pub Stone, and even Labradorite.

The shell pearl is made from mother of pearls, the hard inner layer of the shell of an oyster. The process of making a shell pearl involves several different stages. The raw material for the base of the pearl is the sea shell, which is then cut, rounded, shaped, drilled and strung. The pearls thus formed are later framed and dyed in various shades. After they are baked and polished, they receive their final stringing. 

In order to produce a good quality pearl, a key ingredient is what is called a 'mother of pearl bead'. This element adds weight, value and durability to the pearl. In fact, the materials used in order to make shell pearls are the same materials from which cultured pearls are made.

Onyx is one of the gemstones associated with the month of December and with the zodiac sign of Leo.  

History & Lore: The name Onyx is a derivation of the Greek word 'onux', meaning “fingernail”.  Legend says that a sleeping Venus had her divine fingernails cut off with an arrowhead by Eros/Cupid. He left the clippings scattered on the sand below, which later turned to stone because the gods felt that no part of Venus' heavenly body should ever perish. 

Originally, in Greek times, almost all colors of Chalcedony from white to dark brown and black were labeled as Onyx. It was then later decided by the Ancient Romans that the term Onyx would only be used refer to the black and dark brown colored stones.

The Ancient Romans associated Onyx with courage and it was thought to be useful when defending oneself against criticism. It also is thought to have protective qualities, particularly when traveling. It is believed to bring about spiritual inspiration and assist with keeping emotions and passions under control. It is also believed to help the wearer to change bad habits.

Physically Onyx is believed to strengthen the heart, kidneys, nerves, hair, eyes and nails. It is also believed to relieve stress and neurological disorders and to aid sleep. (Information obtained through www.gemtradenet.com.  Thank you!)

name: Natural Ruby and Freshwater Coin Pearl Earrings
description:
Look and feel like a queen! Inspired by royal jewelry, this elegant pair of earrings features a lustruous white freshwater coin pearl (13mm in diameter) accentuated by tiny faceted natural ruby rondelles.  The combination of the iridencent luminiscence of the pearl  and the fiery red of the ruby will grab everybody's attention for sure.  

The design is finished by an intricate dual-color (silver and gold) metalwork.  

Overall length of the earring is 45mm (approx. 1 3/4").

Like a perfect red rose, the Ruby's rich color speaks of love and passion.  Called the "Rajnapura" or "King of Gems" by ancient Hindus, July's birthstone is among the most highly prized of gems throughout history. The Ruby was considered to have magical powers, and was worn by royalty as a talisman against evil.  

The word Ruby comes from the Latin "ruber," meaning red.  It is a variety of the mineral Corundum, and is found as crystals within metamorphic rock.  Corundum is the second hardest mineral, after Diamond.  It comes in a variety of colors, and is considered a Sapphire in any color except red, which is designated as a Ruby.  Rubies range in hue from an orangey red to a purplish red, but the most prized gems are a true red in color.  Large sized Rubies are very rare and valuable. 

The history of Ruby mining dates back more than 2,500 years ago.  The most beautiful crystals are thought to be from Burma, but quality Rubies are also found in India, Sri Lanka, Australia, Kenya, Tanzania, Afghanistan, Pakistan, and the United States. 

It has been said that the Ruby's red glow comes from an internal flame that cannot be extinguished, making a gift of this stone symbolic of everlasting love.  With its hardness and durability, it is a perfect engagement gem.  And if worn on the left hand, ancient lore has it that the Ruby will bring good fortune to its wearer, too!

name: "Mountain Air" - Rare Peruvian Opal, Pearl and 14K Solid Gold Necklace and Earrings Set
description:
With stones so beautiful and rare, something unique had to be created.  So here is this magnificent necklace and earrings set featuring Peruvian opals, freshwater pearls and 14K solid gold.  Peruvian blue opal is relatively rare and is only found in the Andes mountains near San Patricio, Peru. It is a very translucent stone with color similar to the Caribbean Sea. Depending on how the stone is cut it can be clear, scenic (showing varying degrees of color) or dendritic which has black fern like inclusions.  

The freeform opal nuggets in this set are faceted to capture the light and measure between 20mm and 25mm, varying in color from sky-blue to greenish-blue to golden-blue.  The pearls are of excellent quality, fairly large (10-12mm), and add contrast in beatiful ivory and gold color.  The design is completed by 14K solid gold rondelles and box clasp.  The overall length of the necklace is 19".  

For the earrings I saved two of the most beautiful stones in the strand, in a very light blue color, measuring approx 15x20mm.  The earrings are also finished in 14K solid gold and are 38mm (approx. 1.5") long. 

The pieces can also be purchased separately with a price of $510.00 for the necklace and $85.00 for the earrings.  If interested in purchasing just the necklace or just the earrings, please contact me and I will make the arrangements.  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

Due to the high quality and high price, in addition to the delivery confirmation, this particular item will be shipped with insurance. The shipping charges displayed reflect that.

description:
This unique necklace features beautiful translucent prehnite (approx. 18x27mm) and Tibetan silver beads and components. The freeform prehnite nuggets are faceted, and capture and reflect the light beautifully in swirling green colors, reminiscent of jade. The design is completed by carved Tibetan silver beads and an oversized hook clasp with three rings that will allow sizing within 1 1/2". The overall length of the necklace is 20". 

The earrings are simple, meant to just complete the set and not take away from the dramatic effect of the necklace. They feature a single prehnite flat oval (approx. 12x15mm) accented by tiny silver beads, hanging from custom ear wires. The overall length of the earring is 42mm (approx. 1 5/8"). 

The pieces can also be purchased separately with a price of US $125.00 for the necklace and US $24.99 for the earrings. If interested in purchasing just the necklace or just the earrings, please contact me and I will make the arrangements. 

Handcrafted - One of a kind.

With its gorgeous greens and unique translucency, prehnite is a wonderful rare exotic gem, which despite a suitable durability, has only recently gained popularity as a jewelry gemstone.  Named after the Dutch mineralogist and early governor of the “Cape of Good Hope” colony, Colonel Hendrik Von Prehn (1733–1785) who discovered it in the Cradock district of the eastern Cape province, South Africa in the early 18th century, prehnite was the first mineral to be named after a person.  

History and Lore: Known as the “prediction stone” among spiritual healers, it is believed that prehnite can enhance one’s dreaming and remembrance. Some crystal healers also believe that prehnite’s color and unusual touch are ideal for stress release.

description:
Simple yet sophisticated, this elegant pair of earrings is a must-have. The combination of colors and textures is eye-catching and modern, and goes well with a more elegant outfit as well as with your favorite pair of jeans.  

The 12x19mm freeform aquamarine nugget in a beautiful silvery-blue color is faceted to capture the light and is dangling from a copper french hook style ear wire.  The design is completed by a brushed copper saucer and a 4mm textured copper bead.

Aquamarine is the birthstone for the month of March and is associated with the zodiac sign of Pisces.  

History & Lore :  The name Aquamarine was derived by the Latin words, aqua meaning “water”, and mare meaning “sea”. This is because of its color's close resemblance to sea water.  Aquamarine was considered sacred to the god of the sea, Neptune. It is documented that it was used by the Greeks between 480-300 BC. They would wear Aquamarine amulets engraved with the water god Poseidon to protect them against perils and monsters of the sea.  Legend also says that Aquamarine was the treasure of the mermaids and for this reason, sailors would wear it to keep them safe on voyages out to sea and prevent seasickness.

Aquamarine is also said to have a soothing effect on married couples, helping husbands and wives work out their differences and ensure a long and happy marriage.

Additionally, it is said that Aquamarine will provide its wearer with everlasting youth and happiness, provide courage, cure laziness and quicken the intellect. Aquamarine can replace anger and negativity with mental peace and clarity, providing the wearer with emotional and mental balance. For these reasons it is said to be an effective treatment for anxiety. 

Aquamarine is an effective gemstone for opening the fifth chakra, the throat chakra. Water in which an Aquamarine has been immersed can cure eye problems, swollen glands and helps to maintain healthy teeth and gums.  (Information provided through www.gemtradenet.com.  Thank you.)

description:
Elegant and unique, this pair of earrings features raw, untreated citrine freeform nuggets (approx. 18x18mm), rugged yet so beautiful in their roughness! The design is completed by two freeform Tibetan silver square flat beads and 4mm carved beads.  The french hook style ear wires are forged in sterling silver. Overall length of the earring is 50mm (approx. 2").  

Handcrafted - One of a kind.  

Citrine shimmers and brings a hint of sunshine to those dull, cold November days and it is named after the French word "citron", meaning lemon. The color of citrine ranges from straw and sun yellow, to clay orange, to deep wine colored Madeira red, and like all crystal quartz it has a hardness of 7 on the Mohs scale which makes it insensitive to scratches. It is the official birthstone for the month of November as adopted by the American National Association of Jewelers in 1912, and it is also considered the Planetary stone for the Sun Sign of Virgo.

The majority of citrines available today are actually heat-treated amethysts from Minas Gerais in Brazil.  The naturally occurring stones tend to be cloudy in appearance, like the ones in used for this design, while heated stones will have fine stripes.

Citrine is considered to bring happiness, joy and optimism, and it is one of only two minerals on the planet which do not hold or accumulate negative energy, but dispels and transforms it. Citrine energizes and invigorates, promotes warmth, comfort, and energy.
